attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The proposal by Lord Layard to increase by 10,000 the number of cbt therapists in the NHS ignores the benefits to people of other forms of therapy. Relationship based therapy, such as the Person Centred Approach, and others, have a proven record of helping to alleviate distress and to change lives.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "consider other psychotherapy approaches, not only cbt, in the proposed expansion of psychotherapeutic services within the NHS, instead of restricting choice for members of the public to one only model of therapy."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11280.asp

Prime Minister's Office

Petition info: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Therapy/
